title: What tools should a computer tech have in his tool bag? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on where you are working at, really. When I did DTS at IBM, MCI, etc all I needed really was my Gerber multitool and it's extension kit because everyone had pretty similar desktops. If we needed to rrally tear a machine down it would be brought back to the “tech room” and worked on the “bench” whetr wr had a wide variety of tools. Compare that to when I did DTS for the City of Tulsa; that required us to drive around in a city vehicle and do most work on-site. So our kut there included canned air, a range of screw drivers (normal and precision), flashlight/headlamp, various size neddlenose pliers, anti-static strap, network tester, USB drives, ethernet patch cables, etc. You didn’t want to have to drive back to the main office just because you forgot some tool! Also, carry a partially straightend paperclip, you'd be suprised how often you might need it. Your smart phone is also useful, I highly suggest some type of “camera magnifier app” so you can see various tiny letters easier, take pics of parts that might need replacement, etc.

I’d add a working usb keyboard and mouse, maybe ps2 Not only a flash drive, but a bootable OS(ideally one for diagnostics or repair, but anything helps to be able to back up data or remove some viruses). I also carry some opensource or free virus programs. Depending on how extensively you work, carry a simple/commonly support usb wifi dongle and the drivers for it. I’ve seen several people build or upgrade a computer and not have the ethernet drivers nor wireless drivers. If you get on amazon, for about 20–35 dollars you can get a tool kit with about everything youd need for alonggg time. Just add the cables and flash drive.

I carry a variety of tools depending on what I'll be doing. Clamp meter Line splitter Screw driver Precision screw driver Empty bottle for screws Anti static wristband Knife Needle nose pliers Laptop Ethernet cable HDMI cable Vga cable Flash drive I encounter a lot of different issues though because I work for a school.
